g-1: ^Your flippers cut gracefully through the water, you are at one with the world.

RememberYoureATurtle: ^We've been through this, you're a turtle.

s0: ^You gaze, fondly, at the endless water ahead of you.
s1: ^ The ocean extends, beautiful and blue.

Netted: ^This is new. There's something unusual ahead of you.

c-0: ^You slowly swim closer and examine the structure ahead of you.
^It looks frayed, fibrous. The pieces form a regular pattern too small for you to slip through.
c-1: ^You turn around, and begin your retreat away from the grid which was hanging in the water. But soon enough the regular pattern is in front of you again.
^Wherever you turn, it's on all sides.

Hauled: ^Before you can register the situation, it wraps around you and you are dragged from the water.

c-0: ^You clamp your eyes shut, perhaps in the desperate hope that this will pass if you let it.
^Your stomach turns as you fly through the air.
c-1: ^You watch the water retreat below you as you're hauled further and further into the air.
g-0: ^With a painful crash, you fall against hard ground.
^Through the pain, you try and peer around. Everything is dazzlingly white, and you can hardly see.

c-3: ^You try and bite your captor, but can't reach their hands.

g-1: ^You are cast into a small box, full of water.
^You look up at the square of light from the outside world

c-4: ^You try your hardest to swim up to the lip of the box, but before you can make any headway a lid is slipped on.
c-5: ^Dejected, you merely watch as the lid is slipped on the box.

s0: ^The pocket of air is hardly large enough for you to get your head clear above water.
s1: ^The water sloshing in the box makes it hard to stay in any one spot.
s3: ^You barely have the strength to swim up.

PassedOut: ^After a last attempt, your body betrays you. In the dark of the box, your eyes close.

c-0: ^As you open your eyes, you see the oceans around you.
g-0: ^There are rocks and plants. And another turtle!
g-1: ^but instead bump painfully into something hard.
^As you shake your head, you see your fellow turtle do the same.

g-0: ^With a heavy heart, you realise that you've woken up trapped. Locked in a glass box not much bigger than yourself.

ANoise: ^You hear a noise from the other side of the tank.

c-0: ^You swim over to the origin of the noise.

InvestigateNoise: ^In the corner of the tank, the noise is loudest. It's a scraping sound, and it's coming from the lid!
^It starts to move, and a creature appears in the gap.
HideFromNoise: ^You take comfort in the quiet and dark.

s: ^It occcurs to you that this probably doesn't count as hiding.

c-2: ^You slowly peek out from your home.

OctopusAppears: ^Before you is an octopus, leaning into the tank.

c-0: ^"Me? No, little friend. If anything you should be the one afraid, having an uninvited guest barge into your tank. But you needn't worry; I've come to help."
c-1: ^"Well perhaps a little. But it's not like I can eat you, little friend. With a shell like that, I wouldn't stand a chance."
c-2: ^ "You look a lot calmer than I feel."
^"You're not wrong, little friend. I don't carry many burdens. But you? You've been trapped. You must be glad I came."

c-3: ^The Octopus seems surprised to be asked. He takes a moment.
^"I'm here to free you, of course! To see a turtle trapped like this, I couldn't abide it. So I've come to let you go."

s: ^"You're freeing me because I'm a turtle?"

c-5: ^"Such a majestic creature, it would be wrong to have you bumping up against glass all your days," he replies.

s: ^"But how did you know I was a turtle?"

c-0: ^," you agree, proudly nodding your head.
c-1: ^ you ask. "You only saw me once you opened the tank."
^"A lot of questions for someone who has just been gifted their freedom. I wouldn't want to have to leave you here."

c-6: ^"An aquarium, if you've ever heard of such a thing. Hundreds, maybe thousands of creatures like you, packed into little boxes so that they can be oggled at."
^He gestures grandly with one of his tentacles.
^"It's no life - but consider yourself one of the lucky ones! I can free you, and you have the land legs to make it back to the sea. The others would give anything for that chance."

c-0: ^ you agree. "I'm glad you found me."
c-1: ^"You said thousands of creatures like me. But you're trapped as well, aren't you? Creatures like us."
^"Ah well of course," he replies, a little nervous. "But as you can see I'm freer than most. Hard to keep us octopi locked away you know!"

s: ^"You know 'octopi' is the wrong plural, right? It's a popular misconception."
^"Plurals ending in 'i' are only for words with Latin roots. But octopus comes from the Greek 'oktṓ' meaning eight, and 'poús' meaning foot.
^"So the correct pluralisation would be octopodes if you're going with the Greek or octopuses if you wished, instead, to conform to standard linguistic style."

c-1: ^"The case for your freedom grows stronger by the moment."

g-2: ^The Octopus gestures beyond the tank, to the ground below.
^"There is a drain in the floor here. In case of spillages or water changes in the tanks, it drains straight to the coast. It's latched shut, but we
^ are awfully dexterous. You'll be free again."

c-7: ^"That's fine, little turtle," the Octopus replies. "But let's be quick. Time is of the essence."

s: ^"Have you freed other creatures before me?"
^"That's all I wanted to ask. Let's go."

c-0: ^"Ah I wondered if you'd ask, little friend."
^"But I have been here a long time, and I don't think I could go back to the outside. No, your freedom is enough."
c-1: ^"I have. But it's been such a long time, I can hardly even rememeber them."
^"They seemed so important at the time, too. It's funny what you forget."
c-2: ^ This is all very new to me, I'd like to soak it in before I go."
^"There aren't many who want to sightsee in their prison."

^"But your odd wishes aside, we do have to move quickly. This is a quarantine tank. They're keeping you here until they can move you into the main tank, and if you end up in there... Well, that's the end for you. You'll never be free."

s: ^"I see. Time is of the essence."
^"Why can't I escape from the main tank too?"

c-1: ^"It's their crown jewel. It's monitored far more closely than these little enclosures. All sorts of systems are in place to keep you there."

s: ^"Whoa, that does sound scary. We'd better be quick."

c-1: ^"I don't know them all - I don't go in the main tank. But they have fracture monitoring on the glass, sensors above the tank to check if creatures break out, that sort of thing. It's maximum security."

s: ^"I bet I could break out. I've already broken out of this tank. I'm an escape turtle!"

c-0: ^"It's no good there, little friend." He shakes his head.
c-1: ^"You are not an escape turtle, little friend. I broke you out of here. You are a lucky turtle."

FirstExit: ^The Octopus opens the lid further, until the gap large enough for you to leave with him.
^"It is time, little friend. You'll breathe free air again soon."

c-0: ^The excitement is palpable, this is an adventure!
c-1: ^The exterior of the tank represents the terrifying unknown, but you know you must proceed.
c-2: ^The kindness of this stranger makes you wary, but his help is nonetheless preferable to being stuck in this cage.

b: ^ You are, indeed, the escapiest of the escape turtles.
^ You are, indeed, the luckiest of the lucky turtles.

start_first_drain: ^The Octopus leads you to the drain on the ground below.
^As you get closer you see further down the corridor a huge tank filled with beautiful and varied sea life, all swimming around a central artificial coral reef.

g-0: ^"Yes, now do you see why we must leave quickly."

c-1: ^You shuffle closer to the drain, but the thought of all those fish in that huge glass box sends shivers over your shell.
^You look back at the tank curiously. You wonder what they're like, and when they got caught, and if they miss their friends in the sea.
^The Octopus sighs, "Of course they are, now let's go."
^"No way, I'm going to save them all."

start: ^"We can't leave the others behind! This is no life to live!"
^"They are only fish. They cannot break out like you, they need water to breathe."
^"Surely you are clever enough to come up with something?"

c-0: ^"You are so innocent little turtle friend."
c-1: ^ "Surely you are clever enough to come up with something?"
^"Oh of course, but there are dangers here that you do not understand."

c-0: ^"Fish keep mysteriously disappearing, I would not like to see you .... become a snack."

s: ^"A snack!? Do you think fish are being eaten by someone?"
^"Do you know what is causing these disappearances?"

c-0: ^"... I .... have no clue. However, there is a rumour that the Mantis Shrimp in the corner of the tank has not been the friendliest in his past."
c-1: ^"Not what, but there could be a who."
^"The Mantis Shrimp has, let's say, a suspicious aura about him."

s: ^"I'm sure if we get everyone on board, the Mantis Shrimp cannot hurt us all."

c-0: ^The Octopus looks at you with a smile.
c-1: ^"If you are sure you can convince everyone."

exit_tank_stage_left: ^The Octopus pauses briefly and then stares at you.
^"I think you are making a mistake, but I will help you as I like your determination. It's adorable."
^The Octopus grins widely then points down the hallway.
^"The tank is down there, good luck."

approach_the_drain: ^"Well this is it", the Octopus tells you, gesturing at the drain. "I can open it, and you'll be free to return home."

c-0: ^ you so much, you really are a kind octopus."
^"It really isn't any trouble. You be safe now."
^His tentacle wraps around the complicated looking contraption, squeezing a button and pulling a lever all at once.
^You look down at your flippers and are thankful to have such a helpful friend on your side.

s: ^"I couldn't have done this without you

c-0: ^, you're a real pal," you tell the Octopus, as he pulls open the drain cover and you clamber in.
^He smirks at you, "Don't worry about us in here, we'll be just fine. So long kiddo."

c-1: ^ "I can't do this. I can't just leave them behind, let's go back!"
^The Octopus looks at you sternly, pulls open the drain cover, and gestures towards it.
^"This is your chance, get out while you can."

c-0: ^You push back with your flippers, but don't move anywhere. You realise you're rising off the ground a little, and that you can't move at all.
^You look around wildly, realising there's a tentacle wrapped around your shell.
^ you yell, but it's too late, you're in the drain now.
^"Sorry little friend, you're nothing but trouble."

c-1: ^You know he's right, and push yourself down into the drain.

swirling_drain: ^The water rushes around you, pulling you down into the darkness, where you're suddenly plunged into the sea. It's cold but it's freedom.

c-0: ^The aquarium looms over the pier. It's so much bigger than you ever thought possible.
^Your mind wanders to the people you left behind.

fish_coversation_start: ^As you approach the tank, the fish gather close to the glass, excitedly watching your progress. There seems to be one member of each fish species you've ever seen, and many more you don't recognise. They swim together forming a kaleidoscopic show of colours and patterns, chattering in one voice made of hundreds.
^"Who are you? Welcome! How did you get out? No one has ever escaped before!"

s: ^"The Octopus seems to escape all the time."

c-1: ^The fish are shocked. "Who helped you? How? The captor is the only one who can move fish."
^"The Octopus lifted the lid off my tank," you reply. "He was very kind."
g-0: ^"Who is the Octopus? We know everyone in this room, except newcomers like you. Were you caught together?"
^You turn around to point out your new friend who had so nicely shown you a way out. He is no longer in the room. You are confused why he left, but choose to carry on the conversation.

s: ^"I only arrived yesterday, he seems to have been here much longer."

c-2: ^ Slimy fella, too many legs, he can climb anything and hop between the tanks."
^The fish stare blankly at you, not recognising the creature you're describing.
^"Maybe he can't get into this tank. It's difficult to get in here, but we think there's a way out!"
c-3: ^"Which aquarium were you transferred from?" the fish ask excitedly.

c-0: ^"Your previous tank, where was it? Melbourne? Sydney? Where did you live before this?"

s: ^"This is my first time in a tank. Yesterday I was in the ocean."

c-0: ^You feel wistful as you think of your home.
^"The Ocean!? Shouldn't you still be in quarantine?!"
^This shout came from a worried looking pufferfish.

s0: ^The shoal suddenly flickers and the fish turn away from you, but you can still hear them. "Shush! We shouldn't tell strangers! Can we trust turtles? Fish have to stick together!!"

s: ^"Are none of you from the ocean?
^"I refused to leave here without you!
^"We sea creatures have to stick together!"

c-0: ^ I have seen many fish who look just like you out on the reef."
^"A few fish in this tank are from the reef, and all they can talk about is how great the sea is. Most of us were born here though, and we don't reckon this so called 'sea' is all that."
^"The ocean is great!" you reply. "All your families are out there - clownfish, you all live in the anemonaes, and there is so much room for everyone to swim."
^A few of the fish are excited, and turn back to face you

b: ^ but most of them aren't convinced

c-1: ^ The Octupus told me how to escape, but I saw that you were still trapped and couldn't just leave."

s: ^"Why should I tell you, if you don't trust me?"

c-0: ^The shoal seems to pause for a moment, indecisive.
^You sigh, and tell them. "We can leave through the pipe over there. Now we just need to get you out of this tank!"
c-1: ^ The drain over there leads back out to the ocean, we just need to remove the grill, which the Octopus can do."
^The shoal seems to pause for a moment, indecisive.
^"So if we can leave the tank, we can escape to the ocean?"

c-2: ^The Fish seem unimpressed. "Fish have to stick together. But you hard-shelled lot are a different matter."
^There's a lot of worry in those words - you wonder what makes them so wary.
^"We're all trapped here. That's got to be a worthy common cause, more so than any other worries you might have between us!"
c-3: ^Why should you go out of your way to help mean fish like these?
^"How rude! I come all this way to talk to you and you don't trust me?"
^You turn away from the tank and propel yourself towards the drain, ready to head back to sea.

EnterTank: ^The group of fish have visibly calmed, they seem willing to trust you.
^An older fish comes forward out of the crowd.
^"You said that there's a way out of this room, if we can leave our tank?"

c-0: ^ It leads to the ocean! My friend the Octopus can help us open it when we escape."
g-0: ^The fish all look at each other with some excitement. This may be more hope than they have felt in years.
^"I feel we have much to discuss. Come in."

s: ^"Can't we keep talking through the glass?"

c-1: ^"It's too risky, if the Captor comes through here he'll see you!"
^The mention of the Captor makes the other fish tense. He's clearly not well liked. The older Parrotfish continues talking regardless.

g-1: ^"There is an automated feeder on the side of the tank. We've worked out how to open it, and with those flippers of yours you should be able to climb up."
^You make your way towards the feeder, and follow the fish's instructions to clamber past the gate.

start_tank: ^Diving into the cool waters of the main tank, the sheer amount of life inside the aquarium becomes apparent for the first time.
^"Welcome to the tank, brother!" the Parrotfish who you spoke to before greets you. "Please have a look around."

s0: ^You see many different species swimming around. Many eye you suspiciously and yet the warmth of the community brightens your heart.
s1: ^The tank is large, but it seems crowded with fish.
s2: ^ The small patch of coral in the centre of the tank reminds you of home.
s3: ^The fish seem to hang out in groups, chattering as they swim in circles around the tank.

s0: ^The parrotfish swims over to join you.

c-0: ^ for letting me into your tank - it's much nicer than the little quarantine tank I was in. This place is lovely, but it is too small for so many fish."
^"We get by okay, but I definitely think that this community would be better off in the wild, where we belong. You might need to help me convince some of these fish, though," he says.
^He smiles. "You're quite a charismatic turtle. I'm sure you'll have no problem."
c-1: ^, maybe we should leave the creatures who don't want to come?"
^He frowns. "We are all family, even if they look and think differently. I believe we should stick together, but maybe you're right. We can't force everyone to go."

s0: ^"Are there any questions I can help you with?" he asks kindly.
s1: ^ "Anything else I can tell you about?"
s2: ^ He smiles and awaits your next question

s: ^"Can I talk to the other fish?"

c-0: ^"So what is your plan to get out of this tank?" you ask.
^"We have almost everything figured out. You came in through our way out - there is a flap in the lid."
^ would the captor leave a hole in the lid?" you ask, puzzled.
^The Parrotfish explains that the tank is fed by an automatic system, which lifts the lid at certain times of day.
^"We're now able to open that section whenever we want."
g-0: ^"The issue is, the lid is too far from the surface of the water for us to be able to use it. We think that if we can find a way to block the outlet at the bottom of the tank, we can overfill the tank."
^"The goby is a fanstastic digger and can dig up material for us to use, there is just the matter of convincing him." he says gently.

c-1: ^"Then once you can escape, I'll get the Octopus to remove the grate from the top of the drain, and we can all escape!"
g-0: ^You are both excited by the prospect of returning to the sea.

c-1: ^"The Captor rarely comes in here, but you should hide if they do."

c-0: ^There's a promising looking hollow at the base of the coral.
^"What about that hollow?" you ask, gesturing towards it.
^"That could work," he says hesitantly, "but the old Wrasse tend to hang out there. You might need to talk to them before diving in."
^You see a cave-like structure at the back of the tank.
^"There's a cave over there, would I fit in there?"
^"Ah." You can tell that the Parrotfish is uncomfortable. "The Mantis Shrimp lives there, I wouldn't go that way if I were you."
^You notice that there are no fish swimming in that area of the tank.
^"Right, I'll keep to this side of the tank!"
^There's a patch of long seaweed, you're worried that your fins will get tangled if you go in there.
^"I think that's you best bet for now, if the captor comes along," says the Parrotfish, following your gaze.

c-2: ^"Why was I in a tiny tank?" You are disappointed not to have been included in this community.
^"You were just brought in from the ocean, the captor doesn't know what diseases or parasites you may be carrying." The Parrotfish looks a little wary.
^"Don't worry, I'm fit as a fiddle. I have loads of fish friends on the reef and I've never made them ill!"
^"That is good to hear brother, but this is not my area of expertise. Try talking to the Pufferfish, they know all about this kind of thing."
^You nod. "Thanks for the advice, I'll do that."
c-3: ^ It would be very helpful if we can get everyone on board with the escape plan."
^"Yes, of course. I've been trying for a long time, but maybe people can be convinced by a fresh face. This tank is yours too now, you can do whatever you would like, brother."

s: ^Speak with the Goby at the base of the tank
^None of them, there's no place for me with this lot.
^None of them, I've done everything I want.

dont_belong: ^"Thank you for your kindness, but I've thought it through. I can't remain with you - I should be in quarantine. You have a good thing going, and I'll just ruin it."
^"Are you sure, brother? You said before that sea creatures should stick together and I think you were right."

c-0: ^You turn away and leave with a heavy heart. It is for their own good.
c-1: ^"Doubt comes to all of us" the Parrotfish reassures you "but your arrival here is exactly the break we've been waiting for."
^"I suppose if we're all in the ocean tomorrow, it won't matter if I have been quarantined or not! Let us escape together."

c-0: ^"Brother Parrotfish, thank you for your hospitality."

leave_tank_to_octo: ^"I have to return to my tank to confer with the octopus, so that we are ready to remove the grate when your tank is flooded. I'll come back tomorrow!"
^"Safe travels, friend. We'll be here when you return - it's not like we can go anywhere without you!"
^You take another look around the artificial reef and wave goodbye to your new friends. The thought of escape is even more exciting now you are helping these lovely creatures!
^You swim up to the hatch and clamber out and into the corridor.
start_the_escape: ^Let's make sure we have everything in place.

g-0: ^And then we need to raise the water level so the fish can swim out.

c-2: ^Maybe one of the fish can help.

g-1: ^And then we'll be outside the tank. All that remains is to make it to the sea.

c-4: ^You spread the word, and the fish of the tank gather around you.

^"Thanks to your ingenuity" you say, looking at the Parrotfish "and with a little outside assistance, we will all be in the ocean by tomorrow."

s: ^"Are you ready to venture out, Pufferfish?"
^"What will you do when you're out on the wide ocean, young'uns?"
^"Your fry will have the chance to live their lives in open waters. You must be excited."
^"Goby, are you prepared do to your part?"

c-0: ^She takes a moment. "Yes, I am" she says. "It will be difficult to start again, but we all deserve a chance to be free."

b: ^  "All of us." she repeats, casting a look at the Mantis Shrimp.
^All of us." she repeats, casting a regretful look back at the Mantis Shrimp's corner of the tank.

c-2: ^The shoal of older fish turn and murmer to each other.

c-3: ^"You won't believe how fast I can work."

announcedfish: ^With a deep breath, you and the fish

talk_to_pufferfish_start: ^As you near the Pufferfish, she ducks behind a rock, eyeing you warily.

s: ^"Why are you so scared of me?"

c-0: ^"Hey! Get away from me, germ bag!"
^The Pufferfish looks panicked, takes a deep breath ...

g-0: ^... and suddenly blows up like a big balloon. You take a hasty flap back.

c-1: ^You're not sure that she wants to keep talking.

c-0: ^You decide it's best not to bother the Pufferfish anymore. You head back and talk to another fish
c-1: ^You decide to try to talk to the Pufferfish again, keeping your distance this time.

^This seems to put the Pufferfish at ease, and she slowly deflates back to normal size.

s0: ^"You didn't spend enough time in quarantine! You could infect a load of other fish, some could even die. Our little world is balanced on a knife edge and you have the audacity to barge in with who-knows-what parasites in tow."

s: ^"Why do you think it's balanced on a knife edge? You all look comfortable to me."

c-0: ^"Only at great cost. Most nights fish vanish from the tank, never to be seen again. Do you know why?"

b: ^ They're natural-born escape artists, like me.

g-0: ^"It's because they're infected. Diseased. The Captor knows how delicate our ecosystem is so at the first sign of illness... They get removed."

s: ^"The Parrotfish told me the disappearances were the Mantis Shrimp's doing."

c-3: ^"We've all lost fish close to us, and we want something to blame. Something concrete." She sighs.
^"But it's not him, he's a good guy at heart. Unfortunately a Shrimp with a killer punch is easier to lash out at than the terrifying reality of our precarious health."

s: ^"The other fish aren't scared of me
^"We didn't have quarantine in the ocean!"

c-0: ^"The Captor keeps new fish that come from the ocean in a separate tank for a while in order to make sure they don't bring in any parasites or diseases! It's a necessary part of keeping this tank safe, which you have chosen to neglect."

s: ^"You sound almost like you admire The Captor."

c-0: ^"Of course not!" she says, outraged. "They're the reason we're all trapped here. But as long as we are, I would rather be healthy. And that is one thing they deserves credit for."
c-1: ^She huffs. Her good nature wants to accept your apology, but she knows she's right - You are a danger.
^, aren't they afraid of infection too?"
^"That's because they blame the Mantis Shrimp for the disappearing fish, they don't realise how truly great the risk of infection is."
^"It's like they've never even spoken to him, he's honestly not so bad. But he's spent so long being spurned that he's defensive right off the bat."

^She glowers at you. "If they knew the threat you posed, you'd have been thrown out the way you came in. You're probably carrying a reefload of lethal friends under that shell of yours right now. We're doomed."
c-2: ^She sighs. "Ah, how I miss those days! See, the tank is so small and sterile that even the tiniest disruption can put us all in danger. We have to be more careful in here than we would have to be out there."

s: ^"So if we found a way to escape

c-0: ^, would you want to come with us?"
^The Pufferfish pauses for a second. To your suprise she seems to be taking your suggestion seriously.
^"Yes," she says, tentatively. "I think I would. It would become awfully lonely in here if everyone else left without me..."
^"But the Mantis Shrimp! We can't abandon him! The others won't like it, but please try and convince him to come too. If he knows I sent you, he might just listen"

c-3: ^For the time being, you part ways with the Pufferfish. You imagine she'll appreciate you keeping your distance.

pufferfish_freindly_converse: ^You near the Pufferfish keeping a respectful distance.

talk_to_goby_start: ^The Goby fish digs himself down into the sand a little more

s0: ^ when he sees you come near. He doesn't seem to like strangers

goby_loop: ^Dig yourself a place to sit nearby

c-0: ^"Oh, okay... I'm not sure about this."
c-1: ^As you start to dig, you can feel him getting excited.
^"Yeah! Although I usually do it in the dry, under water it's much more difficult"
^"Well I'm a master of digging under water, I can move a lot of sand very quickly!"
^You finally manage to complete your little hole to sit in. Digging underwater was very difficult indeed. You settle down and turn towards the Goby fish.
^"Do you mind if I ask you a few questions?"
^"Oh, okay! What did you want to talk about?"

c-0: ^"Oh no, I was born here! The ocean sounds scary! So many big hungry fish... And other Captors!"
^"But also lots of hiding holes, and really pretty reefs, and lots and lots of sand!"

s: ^"Yes! There is loads for you to dig into and explore. You know...I know another goby who'd love to dig with you."
^"Yeah there is! So, why do you love digging so much goby?"

c-0: ^"I've never met another goby before, what if they don't like me?"
^"Well I like you goby so I think they will like you too. Besides, it will be nice for you to have a more professional digger than me with you!"
^You can see Goby relaxing more and he swims towards you.
^"Don't worry Turtle, if you want I can teach you how to dig like me."
c-1: ^"Digging is...wait, will you laugh at me?"

^"Only if you'll laugh at me for liking digging too!"

s: ^"I can't just leave them trapped here."

c-0: ^"Let's just say, you're not the first to try to escape, and I'd hate for things to end up as...messily...as they have done before..."

g-0: ^"It's tragic really, I try not to think about it, but I'll never be able to forget their little faces, suffocating on the dry aquarium floor. There's so much that could go wrong."

s2: ^"I don't want to talk, go away."

s: ^"What are you doing?! Open the hatch!"

c-1: ^"I did wonder when you'd catch on, I guess you know already why I can't let you all go."

c-0: ^He laughs, "You smart cookie you, it's just a shame you're too late to save your precious friends now."

c-1: ^He laughs, "Not as smart as you look, huh? Why would I want anything to change in this place? I can come and go as I wish, and have all the midnight snacks I could ask for"

c-0: ^"Are you going to make me spell it out for you?"

^He sighs, smug to have finally told someone his great master plan.

c-12: ^You rush around the room, flapping your flippers, pushing your friends to safety.

final_escape: ^You take one last look around the room. This is it, they're all safe now, and it's time to go home.

g-0: ^The Octopus is curled up in the corner. Colour is slowly returning to his skin, and he seems to be coming around. Part of you pities this lonely creature, but you remember if it weren't for your tough outer shell you'd have been a midnight snack too, and you hurry to the drain before he can spot you.
g-1: ^The water rushes around you, pulling you into the darkness, until you're suddenly plunged into the ocean. When you come to a stand still, you take a look around you, and see all your friends celebrating. Even the mantis shrimp looks happy for once. You breathe a deep sigh of relief, and do a little twirl in the open water.

s: ^Go to the surface and look back

c-2: ^You can't help but take a peek at the prison you found yourself in, and quickly peer out of the water at the shoreline. The aquarium looms over the ocean, it's so much larger than you'd ever imagined.
^After a moment staring at that monstrous place, you turn and swim back to your friends.
